H0.text: Muscular is the body system directly threatened when bacteria infect the lungs.

H1.text: The nervous system is the body system directly threatened when bacteria infect the lungs.

H2.text: The respiratory system is the body system directly threatened when bacteria infect the lungs.

H3.text: The excretory system is the body system directly threatened when bacteria infect the lungs.

A4.text: These secretions can act directly as antimicrobials to help keep the airway free of infection.

A5.text: Surfactant degradation or inactivation may contribute to enhanced susceptibility to lung inflammation and infection.
